0 to 1 million impressions in 3 months using AI...

Context: We ran a small scale content campaign on a flat traffic site using only our SEO insights and AI-generated content.

In its first 3 months, the website had:

260+ keywords in positions 1-3
7.7k+ keywords in 11+ positions
Hit 25k+ clicks in under 3 months
Started ranking and getting traffic 24 hours after its first post
And thousands in revenue

...Here are some principles you need to take into account if you're looking to scale with AI:

ùüè. ùêîùêßùêùùêûùê´ùê¨ùê≠ùêöùêßùêù ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùêìùêöùê´ùê†ùêûùê≠ ùêÄùêÆùêùùê¢ùêûùêßùêúùêû:
Dive deep into what your audience is actively searching for...
‚Üí Scour competitor sitemaps for ideas.
‚Üí Brainstorm around product-centric content.
‚Üí Utilize keyword research tools and assess competitor keyword trends.

ùüê. ùêäùêûùê≤ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùêù ùêëùêûùê¨ùêûùêöùê´ùêúùê°:
Finding new KW opportunities is an art form in itself, but there are longer tailed KWs with buying intent that you can win, even with a brand new site. 
Target these, using tools like KWfinder to determine Link Profile Strength of our competitors, and search for our competitors also targeting our focus keyword.

ùüë. ùêíùê≠ùêÆùêùùê≤ ùêòùê®ùêÆùê´ ùêÇùê®ùê¶ùê©ùêûùê≠ùê¢ùê≠ùê®ùê´ùê¨:
Tools like Detailed can help you see Metrics for Headings, Links, Images, Schema and more for your competitors in top ranking (for now...)

ùüí. ùêÇùê°ùê®ùê®ùê¨ùêû ùêíùêúùêöùê•ùêöùêõùê•ùêû ùêìùê®ùê©ùê¢ùêú ùêíùêûùê´ùê¢ùêûùê¨:
Find a series of topics with 100s or 1,000s of keywords to target and generate content for each topic series

ùüì. ùüè-ùêÆùê© ùê≠ùê°ùêûùê¢ùê´ ùêÇùê®ùêßùê≠ùêûùêßùê≠: 
‚Üí How many words is that article?
‚Üí How do they meet search intent?
‚Üí How many products are included?
‚Üí What headings & subheadings are they using?

Your goal is to 1-up your competitors on all these fronts.

ùüî. ùêíùê≠ùê´ùêÆùêúùê≠ùêÆùê´ùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêñùêûùêõùê¨ùê¢ùê≠ùêû ùêÄùê´ùêúùê°ùê¢ùê≠ùêûùêúùê≠ùêÆùê´ùêû:
Outline a specific area to store your AI-driven content. This could be within your blog or on a specially curated page.

ùüï. ùêîùê¨ùêû ùêÄùêà ùê≠ùê® ùêíùêúùêöùê•ùêû:
Sure, AI might not be the best tool to establish E-E-A-T yet, but it can help you scale your content by providing product descriptions, meta descriptions, calls to action, and more. 

Create:
‚Üí Ideas lists
‚Üí Glossaries

AI spun content also needs to be tested. Play around with custom headings and article specificities

There is ONE common theme within Google's core algorithm updates:

ùêÄùêß ùê®ùêßùê†ùê®ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêûùêüùêüùê®ùê´ùê≠ ùê≠ùê® ùêûùêßùê°ùêöùêßùêúùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêÆùê¨ùêûùê´ ùêûùê±ùê©ùêûùê´ùê¢ùêûùêßùêúùêû.

E-E-A-T plays a crucial role in determining the credibility of a website's trustworthiness and judging if a website and its content genuinely benefit the user. 

For those where SEO is essential to their digital marketing strategy, prioritizing E-E-A-T in your SEO planning is imperative.

It stands for Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness. 

These four pillars are crucial for ranking well in Google's search engine. Let's break them down:

ùêÑùê±ùê©ùêûùê´ùê¢ùêûùêßùêúùêû
What it means: Your content should reflect first-hand experiences on the topic.

How to Optimize: Showcase the faces behind your website. An "About Us" page detailing your team's credentials can be invaluable.

ùêÑùê±ùê©ùêûùê´ùê≠ùê¢ùê¨ùêû
What it means: The depth of knowledge demonstrated in your content.

How to Optimize: Include author bios with relevant qualifications and links to social media profiles.

ùêÄùêÆùê≠ùê°ùê®ùê´ùê¢ùê≠ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùêØùêûùêßùêûùê¨ùê¨
What it means: Being a go-to source on the topic.

How to Optimize: Build a solid content architecture and earn backlinks from other authoritative sites.

ùêìùê´ùêÆùê¨ùê≠ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê≠ùê°ùê¢ùêßùêûùê¨ùê¨
What it means: Earning user trust through experience, expertise, and authoritativeness.

How to Optimize: Maintain a professional-looking site, update content regularly, and avoid errors.

By focusing on these four pillars, you're not just appeasing Google's algorithms‚Äîyou're providing real value to your audience.

posts.text:
If you care about your site, fix these 17 SEO issues immediately.

1. ùóóùòÇùóΩùóπùó∂ùó∞ùóÆùòÅùó≤ ùóñùóºùóªùòÅùó≤ùóªùòÅ: Having the same or very similar content on multiple pages can negatively impact SEO.

2 ùóïùóøùóºùó∏ùó≤ùóª ùóüùó∂ùóªùó∏ùòÄ: Links that lead nowhere or to error pages create a bad user experience and can harm SEO.

3. ùó¶ùóπùóºùòÑ ùó£ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ ùóüùóºùóÆùó± ùóßùó∂ùó∫ùó≤ùòÄ: Slow-loading pages can frustrate users and negatively affect search rankings.
 
4. ùó¢ùóπùó± ùó£ùòÇùóØùóπùó∂ùòÄùóµ ùóóùóÆùòÅùó≤ùòÄ: Avoid older dates showing up against recently published or updated content. This hurts your CTR and your rankings

5. ùóßùóµùó∂ùóª ùóñùóºùóªùòÅùó≤ùóªùòÅ: Pages with very little useful content are often ranked lower by search engines.

6. ùó†ùó∂ùòÄùòÄùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóîùóπùòÅ ùóßùóÆùó¥ùòÄ ùóÆùóªùó± ùóïùóøùóºùó∏ùó≤ùóª ùóúùó∫ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ùòÄ: Images without alt tags or broken images can affect SEO as they contribute to the overall content quality and accessibility.

7. ùó®ùóªùóºùóΩùòÅùó∂ùó∫ùó∂ùòáùó≤ùó± ùó†ùó≤ùòÅùóÆ ùóóùó≤ùòÄùó∞ùóøùó∂ùóΩùòÅùó∂ùóºùóªùòÄ ùóÆùóªùó± ùóßùó∂ùòÅùóπùó≤ùòÄ: Titles and descriptions that are not optimized for keywords and readability can impact click-through rates and rankings.
 
8. . ùóúùó∫ùóΩùóøùóºùóΩùó≤ùóø ùó®ùòÄùó≤ ùóºùó≥ ùóõùó≤ùóÆùó±ùó≤ùóø ùóßùóÆùó¥ùòÄ: Not using header tags (H1, H2, etc.) correctly can make it harder for search engines to understand the structure and content of a page.
 
9. ùóüùóÆùó∞ùó∏ ùóºùó≥ ùó§ùòÇùóÆùóπùó∂ùòÅùòÜ ùóïùóÆùó∞ùó∏ùóπùó∂ùóªùó∏ùòÄ: Not having enough high-quality backlinks can affect a site's authority and ranking.
 
10. ùó£ùóºùóºùóø ùó®ùòÄùó≤ùóø ùóòùòÖùóΩùó≤ùóøùó∂ùó≤ùóªùó∞ùó≤ (ùó®ùó´): Websites that are difficult to navigate or unengaging can lead to high bounce rates, which can negatively impact SEO.
 
11. ùó¢ùòÉùó≤ùóøùòÇùòÄùó≤ ùóºùó≥ ùóûùó≤ùòÜùòÑùóºùóøùó±ùòÄ (ùóûùó≤ùòÜùòÑùóºùóøùó± ùó¶ùòÅùòÇùó≥ùó≥ùó∂ùóªùó¥): Excessively using keywords can lead to penalties from search engines for spammy behavior.
 
12. ùó°ùóºùòÅ ùó®ùòÄùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó¶ùòÅùóøùòÇùó∞ùòÅùòÇùóøùó≤ùó± ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ (ùó¶ùó∞ùóµùó≤ùó∫ùóÆ ùó†ùóÆùóøùó∏ùòÇùóΩ): Failing to implement structured data can result in missed opportunities to enhance search result listings and improve click-through rates.

 13. ùóúùóªùó∞ùóºùóªùòÄùó∂ùòÄùòÅùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùó°ùóîùó£ (ùó°ùóÆùó∫ùó≤, ùóîùó±ùó±ùóøùó≤ùòÄùòÄ, ùó£ùóµùóºùóªùó≤ ùó°ùòÇùó∫ùóØùó≤ùóø) ùó≥ùóºùóø ùóüùóºùó∞ùóÆùóπ ùó¶ùóòùó¢: Inconsistencies in business listings can harm local SEO efforts.

14. ùóúùó¥ùóªùóºùóøùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó¶ùóºùó∞ùó∂ùóÆùóπ ùó¶ùó∂ùó¥ùóªùóÆùóπùòÄ: While not a direct ranking factor, social signals (like shares and likes) can indirectly affect SEO by increasing visibility and traffic.

15. ùóúùó∫ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ ùó£ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ùòÄ ùó∂ùóª ùó™ùóºùóøùó±ùó£ùóøùó≤ùòÄùòÄ: Every image uploaded may have its own page, which Google indexes. Plugins like Yoast can redirect attachment URLs to the image, maintaining a clean site footprint.

16. ùóõùóßùóßùó£ ùó£ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ùòÄ: Ensure all pages are secure (HTTPS). Use the ‚Äòsite:domain inurl:-https‚Äô search command to find non-secure pages.

17. ùó®ùóªùó∂ùóªùòÅùó≤ùóªùó±ùó≤ùó± ùóúùóªùó±ùó≤ùòÖùó≤ùó± ùó£ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ùòÄ: Perform a site:domain search with terms like ‚ÄúLorem ipsum,‚Äù ‚ÄúPortfolio,‚Äù ‚ÄúDemo,‚Äù ‚ÄúIndex,‚Äù ‚ÄúError,‚Äù ‚ÄúTest,‚Äù or a blank search to find and address low-quality pages.

document.title: Keyword Research with Google Search Console

posted_at.relative: 1 year ago ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

posts.text:
In 3 months we got one of our SaaS client‚Äôs freemium tools: 641 product signups, 123K organic traffic and a 0.52% conversion rate.

With a large-scale TOFU SEO campaign using only AI-generated content.

In less than 3 months, this URL subfolder:

- Has 284 indexed pages
- Started getting traffic in first 24 hours
- 130K+ clicks
- 2,500,000+ impressions
- 500+ Google snippets
- 400+ keywords in position 1-3
- 700+ keywords in position 4-10

The point of this content is 2 things:
1. Builds your site's authority in the eyes of Google

2. Drives top-of-funnel traffic which provides other benefits (i.e. email capture) and helps you rank for other more competitive, bottom-of-funnel keywords.

We still use a team of human writers and editors. Our strategy is using AI content for Top-of-Funnel traffic and human-written content with conversion-focused copy and keywords for bottom-of-funnel and for this client it‚Äôs been working wonders.

Want to implement an AI driven TOFU strategy? Here‚Äôs how:

1. ùêÅùêûùê†ùê¢ùêß ùê∞ùê¢ùê≠ùê° ùêö ùê¨ùê¢ùêßùê†ùê•ùêû ùêüùê´ùêöùê¶ùêûùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê§ ùê®ùêü ùê¨ùêúùêöùê•ùêöùêõùê•ùêû ùê§ùêûùê≤ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùêùùê¨

For example:

‚Üí {xyz} Ideas
‚Üí What is {Term}
‚Üí What is {Term} Difference
‚Üí How to {Do Thing} in {Tool}
‚Üí {Term} vs {Term} Difference

2. ùêÇùê´ùêûùêöùê≠ùêû ùê¨ùêúùêöùê•ùêûùêù-ùêÆùê© ùê©ùêöùê†ùêû ùê≠ùê¢ùê≠ùê•ùêûùê¨
‚Üí as many titles as you can with your keyword framework

posts.text:
Want to scale your sales channels to 7-figures with SEO Content?

Start by following these 7 Best Practices:

ùüè. ùêñùê´ùê¢ùê≠ùêû ùêüùê®ùê´ ùê°ùêÆùê¶ùêöùêßùê¨ ùêüùê¢ùê´ùê¨ùê≠!
Yes we are writing for Google and other search engines, but at the end of the day our readers are humans and not robots. Try to make your writing fun and engaging first and then apply SEO rules.

ùüê. ùêîùê¨ùêû ùê§ùêûùê≤ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùêùùê¨ ùê≠ùê°ùê´ùê®ùêÆùê†ùê°ùê®ùêÆùê≠ ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùê≠ùêûùê±ùê≠.
Combine the main keyword with its Alts. These will be detailed in the article's Asana task. If not, try to come up with a few yourself. Use SEO tools like Google Ads, SEMRush, and even simple on-site search bars to identify broad search intent and your main keywords. IMPORTANT: focus on readability rather than keyword density. Try to get your KWs in the text smoothly. Don't sound repetitive!

ùüë. ùêäùêûùêûùê© ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùê©ùêöùê´ùêöùê†ùê°ùêöùê©ùê°ùê¨ ùê¨ùê°ùê®ùê´ùê≠!
Over 85% of our readers access Herb on a mobile device. If they see a very long paragraph, they will probably get bored and leave the page. Try to keep your paragrpahs to a few lines. 

ùêìùêàùêè: when uploading an article to WordPress, a good rule of thumb is to keep them between 3-5 lines long.

ùüí. ùêëùêûùêöùêù ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê©ùêûùê≠ùê¢ùê≠ùê®ùê´ ùêöùê´ùê≠ùê¢ùêúùê•ùêûùê¨ ùêüùê®ùê´ ùê¢ùêßùê¨ùê©ùê¢ùê´ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêöùêßùêù ùê¢ùêùùêûùêöùê¨!If you have to write a Review for a product, Google it and read the first articles that show up. See the words they use in the text and especially in the headings.

ùüì. ùêìùê´ùê≤ ùê≠ùê® ùêöùêùùêù ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêßùêöùê• ùê•ùê¢ùêßùê§ùê¨ ùê¢ùêü ùê≤ùê®ùêÆ ùê¨ùêûùêû ùêöùêß ùê®ùê©ùê©ùê®ùê´ùê≠ùêÆùêßùê¢ùê≠ùê≤.

ùüî. ùêàùêü ùê≤ùê®ùêÆ'ùê´ùêû ùê∞ùê´ùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêö ùêÅùêûùê¨ùê≠ ùêéùêü, ùê¨ùêûùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêöùê´ùê≠ùê¢ùêúùê•ùêûùê¨ ùê≠ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê´ùêöùêßùê§ ùêüùê®ùê´ ùê≠ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê§ùêûùê≤ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùêù ùêöùêßùêù ùê∞ùê´ùê¢ùê≠ùêû ùêö ùê•ùê®ùêßùê†ùêûùê´ ùêöùê´ùê≠ùê¢ùêúùê•ùêû! If you're writing an article and the competitor that ranks #1 for that keyword has 10 products, your article should have at least one more. Try to use concrete numbers (5,10, 15, etc) rather than irregular ones (13, 17, etc)


ùüï. ùêçùêÑùêïùêÑùêë ùêöùêùùêù ùêßùêÆùê¶ùêõùêûùê´ùê¨ ùê®ùê´ ùêûùê±ùêúùêûùê¨ùê¨ùê¢ùêØùêû ùê≠ùêûùê±ùê≠ ùê¢ùêß ùêö ùê¨ùê•ùêÆùê† (unless it‚Äôs the name of a brand/product) and DO NOT change slugs of existing articles.

ùêèùêëùêé ùêìùêàùêè: when it comes to slugs and URLs, the best thing to do is to limit yourself to the main keword of the article.
ùêàùêåùêèùêéùêëùêìùêÄùêçùêì: Make sure to add the words of the main keyword to the slug.

If it‚Äôs a best of article, make sure to add the words ‚Äúbest‚Äù to the slug.
If it‚Äôs a review article, make sure to add the word ‚Äúreview‚Äù to the slug.
If it‚Äôs a ‚Äúwhat is‚Ä¶‚Äù article, make sure to add the words ‚Äúwhat is‚Äù to the slug.

posts.text:
What makes a perfect blog post?

It's a blend of art, science, and a solid SEO strategy.

Here's a clear checklist of the Anatomy of a Perfect Blog:

‚úîÔ∏è SEO Metadata:

- Title: Craft a compelling title with your target keywords. Though not a direct ranking factor, it's bolded in search results and should include a call-to-action (CTA).
- 
- Description: Write a descriptive meta that entices clicks, similar to a well-crafted ad.
- 
- URL: Ensure it matches your target keywords. Avoid duplicate page structures and refrain from including years in URLs.

‚úîÔ∏è Schema Markup:

Implement schema types like Article, BlogPosting, and Breadcrumbs for enhanced SERP presentation.

‚úîÔ∏è Original Images:

Every image should have an Alt attribute for SEO and accessibility.

‚úîÔ∏è Content-Length:

Aim for a minimum of 700 words, adjusting based on competition and query specificity.

‚úîÔ∏è Table of Contents with Jump Links:

Utilize anchor links for easy navigation. Google indexes these, enhancing user experience (UX) and providing valuable data.

‚úîÔ∏è Heading Structure:

Follow a proper format with a single H1 and supporting text under each heading. Use H3s and H4s appropriately.

‚úîÔ∏è Internal Links:

Ensure every page has internal links leading to and from it. This aids in crawl efficiency and contextual relevance.

‚úîÔ∏è Product Card Embeds:

Embed product cards to increase CTR. Test different CTAs, especially for high-traffic articles.

‚úîÔ∏è HTML Elements:

Use lists, tables, and accordions to capture featured snippets and improve UX metrics like session duration.

‚úîÔ∏è YouTube Video Embed:

Ideally, pair each blog post with a complementary YouTube video. Embedding videos can serve as backlinks and enhance visibility on both Google and YouTube.

‚úîÔ∏è CTA for Engagement:

Encourage user engagement with clear CTAs. This can lead to better interaction metrics and conversions.


Check each one of these points when creating your blog posts and you'll not just be writing content; you'll be crafting an experience that resonates with your readers and search engines alike.

posts.text:
What makes a site rank?

Major ranking factors can be summed up into these 3 categories:

1. Age ‚Äì how old the website is, the age of the URL in the index, when the content was published, etc ‚Äì the only thing that can‚Äôt be gamed.


2. Focus ‚Äì how laser focused the content is on the page to the target search term.¬† Not just written content, but also videos, images, code, etc.¬† This is on-page SEO.

By optimizing your content to match the target keywords, Google will reward the page and rank it higher.

- The Title Tag carries the most ranking weight on the page, and the focus keyword must be included.

- The meta description technically has no ranking value, but including keywords here is crucial as Google will bold words from the query which helps increase click through rate.

- The headings on the page also carry a lot of ranking value, so it‚Äôs important to include long tail variations or related keywords in your subheadings.


3. Trust ‚Äì the authority of the domain name based on backlinks and the individual page‚Äôs link profile strength.¬† This is off-page SEO.

Building backlinks solely for the purpose of ranking is actually against Google‚Äôs terms of service they have set out.

In today‚Äôs algorithm it is usually best to generate links naturally by creating great content that other websites will link to as a reference.

There are also other methods to help increase the chance of acquiring links, like creating embeddable videos for other websites to add to their pages, or by sponsoring events and organizations that link back to their donors.

Understanding and optimizing for these three core ranking factors‚ÄîAge, Focus, and Trust‚Äîcan significantly enhance your website's search engine rankings. Keep these principles in mind, and you'll pave the way for improved visibility and organic traffic growth.

posts.text:
You don‚Äôt need ‚Äúlink building‚Äù trickery to rank in Google. 

Instead, you can go from 0 to 100k+ monthly views just by posting perfectly optimized blog posts 3x per week.

But what is a ‚Äúperfectly optimized‚Äù post?

It's a blend of art and science.

Let‚Äôs dive in.

‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì

‚úîÔ∏è SEO Metadata 

Treat it like an ad or social post‚Äîit must be compelling to get people to click.

‚Ä¢ Title: Write a compelling hook with your target keywords. 
‚Ä¢  Description: Treat it like ad copy, hook their interest so they click.
‚Ä¢  URL: Match your target keywords.


‚úîÔ∏èSchema markup

‚Ä¢  Implement schema types like Article, BlogPosting, and Breadcrumbs so your content displays on the SERP. 

If yours doesn‚Äôt, someone else‚Äôs will.


‚úîÔ∏è Original images

‚Ä¢  Add alt tags to every image for SEO visibility and accessibility. Describe the key elements as if someone can‚Äôt see them.
‚Ä¢  Break up large chunks of text with visuals.
‚Ä¢  Stock photos, no thank you.


‚úîÔ∏è Content length:

‚Ä¢ Aim for a minimum of 700 words, adjusting based on:

1. Competition: 
If competitors are at 1,000 words, make a more thorough article that‚Äôs 1,500+ words.

2. Query specificity: 
‚Ä¢  Super specific keyword = short article. 
‚Ä¢ Broad keyword = extensive article.


‚úîÔ∏è Table of contents with anchor links:

‚Ä¢  For longer articles (1,000+ words) add a table of contents to make it easy to jump to what they care about.


‚úîÔ∏è Heading structure:

‚Ä¢ Use only one H1‚Äîthe title of the article, ideally with the target keyword.
‚Ä¢ Add supporting text under each heading to add context.
‚Ä¢ Use H2s, H3s, and H4s appropriately.
‚Ä¢ Make headings compelling. You have to keep them interested.


‚úîÔ∏è Internal links:

Internal links are essential. SEO experts say they‚Äôre more important than backlinks.

‚Ä¢ Ensure every page has internal links leading to and from it. 
‚Ä¢ If you have a long article targeting a high-level keyword ( ), each section could link to another dedicated blog article 
‚Ä¢  Aim for posts to have 7+ internal links by cross-linking related articles.


‚úîÔ∏è HTML elements:

‚Ä¢ Use lists, tables, and accordions to capture featured snippets. 

It makes the article more delightful for readers so they stay longer.


‚úîÔ∏è YouTube embed:

‚Ä¢  Pair each post with a YouTube video. Embedding videos act as backlinks and enhance visibility on Google and YouTube.

Shopify grew its YouTube to 230k subscribers in 18 months with this strategy.


‚úîÔ∏è Clear, compelling CTA 

‚Ä¢ Include clear CTAs throughout the article to turn readers into leads. 
‚Ä¢ Add contextually relevant lead magnets (email courses/PDFs) to each article.

‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì

Thanks to Rob Hoffman and Jake Ward for their help with this one.

In the meantime, here's a clear checklist of the Anatomy of a Perfect Blog:

‚úîÔ∏è SEO Metadata:

- Title: Craft a compelling title with your target keywords. Though not a direct ranking factor, it's bolded in search results and should include a call-to-action (CTA).

- Description: Write a descriptive meta that entices clicks, similar to a well-crafted ad.

- URL: Ensure it matches your target keywords. Avoid duplicate page structures and refrain from including years in URLs.

‚úîÔ∏è Schema Markup:

Implement schema types like Article, BlogPosting, and Breadcrumbs for enhanced SERP presentation.

‚úîÔ∏è Original Images:

Every image should have an Alt attribute for SEO and accessibility.

‚úîÔ∏è Content-Length:

Aim for a minimum of 700 words, adjusting based on competition and query specificity.

‚úîÔ∏è Table of Contents with Jump Links:

Utilize anchor links for easy navigation. Google indexes these, enhancing user experience (UX) and providing valuable data.

‚úîÔ∏è Heading Structure:

Follow a proper format with a single H1 and supporting text under each heading. Use H3s and H4s appropriately.

‚úîÔ∏è Internal Links:

Ensure every page has internal links leading to and from it. This aids in crawl efficiency and contextual relevance.

‚úîÔ∏è Product Card Embeds:

Embed product cards to increase CTR. Test different CTAs, especially for high-traffic articles.

‚úîÔ∏è HTML Elements:

Use lists, tables, and accordions to capture featured snippets and improve UX metrics like session duration.

‚úîÔ∏è YouTube Video Embed:

Ideally, pair each blog post with a complementary YouTube video. Embedding videos can serve as backlinks and enhance visibility on both Google and YouTube.

‚úîÔ∏è CTA for Engagement:

Encourage user engagement with clear CTAs. This can lead to better interaction metrics and conversions.

Check each one of these points when creating your blog posts and you'll not just be writing content; you'll be crafting an experience that resonates with your readers and search engines alike.

document.title: 3 ways to know if a SEO agency is ripping you off

posted_at.relative: 1 year ago ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

posts.text:
SEO pros use complicated words to trick you into thinking it‚Äôs hard. 

In reality, SEO is simple‚Ä¶ 

Here‚Äôs how it works: 

For starters, why choose SEO over other marketing channels? 

SEO is the only channel that lets you get in front of your ideal customers at the exact moment they‚Äôre searching for your product or solution. 

This is why SEO is one of the top 2 highest ROI marketing channels on the planet. 

To do this, you need to publish content on your website that perfectly matches what your customers are searching on Google. 

These search terms are called ‚Äúkeywords.‚Äù 

To find the best keywords, use SEO tools like SEMRush or Ahrefs. 

Keyword research is a lot of trial and error: thinking of potential keywords your ideal customers might search, and looking them up on your SEO tools.

The best keywords fit 3 simple criteria: 

1. Are enough people searching for this keyword?¬†
2. Can I successfully compete for this keyword? 
3. Does this keyword have ‚Äúbuying intent‚Äù behind it? 

If the answer to these 3 questions is ‚Äúyes,‚Äù write a piece of content about that keyword. 

The keywords with the highest number of searches, lowest competition, and highest ‚Äúbuying intent‚Äù are your Primary Keywords. 

Primary Keywords = the title of your article.

Other related keywords that also fit those 3 criteria, but to a slightly lesser extent, are your Secondary Keywords. 

Secondary Keywords = the H2 subheadings of your article. 

Before you write your article, take a look at what other articles are already ranking for your Primary Keyword. 

Ask yourself:¬†
1. How long are the top-ranking articles?
2. What H2 and H3 subheadings are they including?¬†
3. What parts of their content are unclear or lack key information?
4. What images, videos, or infographics are they using in their articles?

Now your job is simple: make your article better than the others. 

Rinse and repeat as many times as you can. 

Obviously, there are many nuances that I‚Äôm not covering here. 

Technical SEO and building a strong Trust Flow score are also important. 

But get the content right, and you‚Äôre 80% of the way there. 

Good luck out there!

Most businesses make 1 major mistake that can permanently damage their site‚Äôs SEOüëá 

They make major changes to their website without consulting with an SEO, and accidentally wreak havoc on their website‚Äôs traffic.

This commonly happens with ‚Äúsite migrations‚Äù 

We‚Äôve seen businesses lose up to 90% of their organic traffic in a single day, thanks to this mistake.

Why does this happen? Because the developers who make structural changes to your website know nothing about SEO.

As a result, they miss key SEO best practices such as:

1. Implementing redirects
2. Updating URLs to avoid 301 errors for internal and menu links.¬†
3. Maintaining the URL structures exactly the same as they were pre-migration

As a result, your website loses all of the ‚Äúbacklink juice‚Äù as well as the page indexing and age you‚Äôve spent the last several years building.

Luckily, the solution to this problem is easy: always have an experienced SEO oversee major website changes like migrations.

When our clients make major changes to their website, like migrating from Wordpress to Shopify for example, we help them every step of the way.
